name: Bridging Minds - Improving the Primary Care System with Human and Machine Intelligence
description:
Primary care in Ontario is in crisis, with over 2 million people not having regular access to primary care. This webinar with Dr. Onil Bhattacharyya will describe the various places patients can seek primary care and describe how artificial intelligence can support both patients and providers. These new tools should be built with and for patients so that the healthcare system can support everyone's unique needs and health journeys.

Through monthly discussions led by experts in the field, this series empowers communities to navigate health/science topics confidently.

name: Toronto Games Week Closing Party
description:
Close out a playful week in the artsy hub that is 401 Richmond. Enjoy some music, pour some libations, and check out the last day of the week-long installation of OMNIVOX: a magical cube pulsing with 4,096 fully addressable LEDs and featuring a custom game designed by Callum Hay, Sara Vinten, and Jessica Mak. Co-presented by Trinity Square Video.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto's local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It's a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto's thriving gaming community!

name: Nathan Phillips Square Farmers' Market
description: Celebrating 35 amazing years, proudly bringing, Ontario farm-fresh produce, pastries, preserves and artisanal products to our beloved city of Toronto!  Your local Ontario, family farms, area artisans and entrepreneurs thank you for this opportunity!

name: Courtyard Farmers' Market
description:
A quaint neighbourhood market celebrating our second season! Aiming to promote Ontario Farmers, eclectic entrepreneurs and local businesses in a spirit of community, fun and wellness.

Enjoy farm-fresh produce and a range of artisanal products that reflect Toronto's diversity!

name: Seriously Fun: Showcase & Social hosted by Wero - Toronto Games Week
description:
Interested in games being used for educational, instructive or political purposes? Join our community of serious game enthusiasts and developers as we gather for a free mini-showcase highlighting innovative projects and fostering a casual exchange of ideas, insights, and camaraderie. If you'd like to showcase your project, tell us in the registration.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto's local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It's a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto's thriving gaming community!

name: Women's Entrepreneurship Forum 2025: Technology, Talent & Transformation
description:
The City of Toronto's Women's Entrepreneurship Forum is a dynamic, in-person event designed to inspire, educate, and connect women entrepreneurs at all stages of their business journey.
This year's forum will explore how women entrepreneurs can leverage emerging technologies, tap into high-growth sectors and refine their digital capabilities to drive business success.
Topics include adopting AI, exploring growing industries like Femtech, and enhancing digital capabilities.
In partnership with the Diversity Institute and the Women Entrepreneurship Knowledge Hub (WEKH), the forum will feature discussions, workshops, and an interactive mini-tradeshow and networking sessions.
Join us for an inspiring day of learning, connection, and growth as we celebrate and empower women entrepreneurs in Toronto!

organizer.name: City of Toronto's Small Business Enterprise Centre

name: Yonge Street - An Incredible History of Music and Pop Culture
description:
Join local historian, Mark Vendramini, as he explores one of Toronto's most iconic street's connection to music, theatre, pop culture. Learn about its rise to music and theatre mecca status equal to, or even better than, Times Square or Hollywood Boulevard.

If you are a music fan, a local history buff or if you just like hearing great stories, then this is an introduction to the city's musical past that will show you a side of "The Strip" that you never knew existed.

organizer.name: Toronto's First Post Office | Town of York Historical Society

name: Public Market Week at Montgomery's Inn
description:
Montgomery's Inn will be collaborating with Local MRKT to kick off the summer with a special extended Farmers Market on Wednesday June 18th. This exciting market week event will feature new artisanal vendors, a live musical performance, activities for all ages, and of course the Montgomery's Inn Farmers Market vendors. Special Musical Guest: Dario Dvon
Local MRKT hosts and curates vendor markets and events across Toronto with a variety of small businesses, sponsors, and community leaders.

name: Pride Toronto Book Launch - Palm Meridian by Grace Flahive
description:
You are invited to the Toronto release party of the stunning debut novel Palm Meridian by Grace Flahive. Offering a rare combination of timely themes, Canadian ties, and incredible storytelling. Don't miss this unforgettable book launch during Pride Month—a celebration of LGBTQ+ stories, voices, and community.

Grace Flahive was born and raised in Toronto, Canada. She studied English literature at McGill University in Montreal before moving to London, UK, in 2014, where she's lived ever since. 

Praise for Palm Meridian, "Flahive is unflinching in her depiction of a future ravaged by climate change, where former towns are overgrown and flooded, and Disney World has fallen into ruin. It's a stirring tale of living and dying on one's own terms." - Publishers Weekly

name: Rosalie Favell | Belonging (1982 - 2024)
description:
Belonging is the first retrospective of renowned Red River Metis artist Rosalie Favell, showcasing a powerful curated selection of her lens-based works from 1982 to 2024. 

This exhibition celebrates Favell's groundbreaking photographic practice, from seminal series like Living Evidence and Plain(s) Warrior Artist to her expansive archive Facing the Camera. This archive invites us to bear witness and explore the complex themes of identity, empowerment, same-sex desire, community and the nuanced search for belonging through a lens that is both deeply personal and subtly subversive.

name: Chikanishing Art Exhibition by Sharon Helleman

location.name: Artists' Network at the Leslie Grove Gallery

description: Based on imagery of the battered and weathered rocks of northern Georgian bay, Chikanishing probes themes of resilience and hope. Impressed by both the resilience of this place, as well as the patterns and colours of the rocks, this new series by Sharon Helleman explores this wild and yet life-filled landscape.

name: Wednesday Night Dinner with Zoe Thiessen's Album Release
description:
Zoe Thiessen is a singer/songwriter, guitarist and violinist now based in Toronto after years of living abroad. Her finely crafted indie folk songs always have a hint of the fairy tale about them, and she delivers them with a warm alto that has a timbre all its own. She released her first album 'The Lives of Saints and Sinners' in 2012, described by Penguin Eggs Magazine as 'a sparkling debut.' Now, back in Toronto, she is performing her own material alongside Toronto guitar veteran Jessica Stuart, with intricate arrangements reminiscent of Andrew Bird. This album release concert will feature songs from 'Sneak Back In', a collection of six songs, produced by Stuart, that range from heartbreakingly intimate to cathartically danceable. She will be joined by Stuart on electric guitar, Liam Fortunate Smith on bass and Lowell Whitty on drums.

Opening is Charles Tilden, a multi-instrumentalist, singer and songwriter based in Toronto. Charles was the primary songwriter for indie rock bands P

name: Colour is Art Exhibition
description: Get immersed in representational art and compositions reminiscing childhood surroundings and dreams in a visual language of shapes, forms and colour. Presented in an inspiring solo show by Victor de M.
